column4: in ubuntu is there anyway to put two avi's back together as one big one that was separated on a win machine
you will need the transcode package (sudo apt-get install transcode)
is this possible to do with avidemux as well cause g/f is not going to like commandline
you can use avidemux yes, but commandline is much easier IMHO
I merely meant is avimerge installed in ubuntu by default
was looking for how to merge in avidemux do you know what it is labelled as?
yes but trying to teach her cli is going to be difficult as there are many split avi's box had no dvd burner in it
it gave me invalid input file when using avimerge is there credentials for the output filename?
you did this right: avimerge -o outputfilename.avi -i part1.avi part2.avi
thank you very much avimerge work quite well and all synced up
